text: If Bloodlines 2 can replicate only one thing from the original, I'd just love for it to be the atmosphere; there are few games that feel like home to me, but somehow, these dark and shady streets do, mainly because they feel so real; they ooze real personality. Can't wait to Toreador the place up again.

author: Ivain

text: Dues Ex is a great game but it's not the "standard" in this genre by any means. While I did enjoy this game mostly due to the insanely awesome OST, I thought the rest of it was a bit...dull. A lot of good ideas, but not enough polish. I know the game didn't get the full attention it deserved but just imagine if it did !!
author: Myth0s

text: This music makes me want to walk around the seedy parts of LA on a summer night, getting into trouble for fun and profit.
author: jdng86

text: This was a pretty decent attempt at delivering both the storytelling and RPG mechanics of the tabletop VtM to video gaming. Of course there are limits to how well you can do that to begin with, but having some history with the original tabletop games by White Wolf, I was at least somewhat satisfied with what they did in order to relate the source material while making a game of their own.
author: Lari Fagerholm

text: Ah the first meeting with VV, i was instantly enchanted by the music. Fantastic game and there are still patches released on a regular basis. If you look for a dark and athmospheric Action-RPG play VtMB, one of the best games ever made!
